abstract: Analysis in journal The Lancet Oncology finds breast cancer drug letrozole reduces the chances that a woman's cancer will return and improves her odds of survival to a greater degree than tamoxifen, a widely used estrogen blocker.
snippet: The drug letrozole reduces the chances that a woman’s breast cancer will return and improves her odds of survival to a greater degree than tamoxifen, a study shows.
lead_paragraph: The drug letrozole reduces the chances that a woman’s breast cancer will return and improves her odds of survival to a greater degree than tamoxifen, a study shows.

headline.main: Regimens: Better Blocker of Breast Cancer Recurrence
headline.print_headline: Regimens: Better Blocker of Breast Cancer Recurrence
headline.seo: Letrozole Surpasses Tamoxifen at Reducing Breast Cancer Recurrence
